entries.meaning: (law) the person whose money is garnished

verbs.description: garnishee (third-person singular simple present garnishees, present participle garnisheeing, simple past and past participle garnisheed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, law) To have (money) set aside by court order (particularly for the payment of alleged debts); to garnish.
examples: Her bank account was garnisheed to pay an outstanding tax debt.
